PLANO, TEXAS /FINANCE – DATA ANALYTICS /FULL-TIME/ ON-SITE

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data from businesses, cases, sales, and user activity to support operational and strategic advancements across the organization.




Who we are:

LeadsOnline is a powerful digital platform that helps law enforcement investigators and analysts advance criminal cases through the most current data on people and property across the U.S., and helps businesses reduce the hassles of reporting. Law enforcement agencies of every size and mandate use LeadsOnline to find suspects, stolen items, and patterns of individual and organized criminal activity. Businesses, including pawn shops, secondhand stores, scrap metal recyclers, and online marketplaces trust LeadsOnline more than any other system to freely, frictionlessly, and safely report transaction information to law enforcement.

In 2022, LeadsOnline acquired Hawk Analytics, provider of CellHawk, the leader in mapping and analysis of Call Detail Records and other location-based digital evidence. CellHawk is instrumental in extracting rapid answers from messy digital evidence to connect suspects to crimes. We’re thrilled at the good we’re already doing together.

Together, we are building the future of criminal investigations, and need people who are mission-driven, love technology, and who won’t settle for less than excellence to join our team.




Role and responsibilities:

LeadsOnline exists to advance cases, careers, causes, and compliance with its unique data, well-designed technology, and exceptional teamwork. We do this through our principles of service, energy, diligence, and persistence. The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing data from businesses, cases, sales, and user activity to support operational and strategic advancements across the organization.

Your primary focus involves 1) establishing data integrity and efficiencies, 2) building a foundation of performance reporting and data enablement, and 3) analyzing data to support and drive strategic decisions across functional teams within the company (e.g., Product, Sales, Client Support).

With a comprehensive understanding of the business, you keenly identify trends and patterns to form hypotheses and provide recommendations to solve complex problems. You will be the backbone and support engine to enabling our team to work smarter by making data-driven decisions.




The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for:

Data Integrity:

Architect and standardize advanced metrics, along with meticulous metric definitions and calculations, fostering a cohesive data interpretation throughout the organization. Thoroughly document metadata where applicable.
Devise and implement sophisticated systems to consistently scrutinize and validate data completeness and configuration accuracy across multifaceted data sources, such as business transactions, case data, sales activity, and pipeline data.
Champion the development and curation of optimal practices for the storage, condensation, transmission, and utilization of intricate technical and operational data. This encompasses formulating strategic approaches like generating concise summary tables, constructing robust data feeds and pipelines, crafting efficient stored procedures, and streamlining workflows.

Foundation of Insights:

Build foundational data structures in support of functional teams across the business to enable continuous awareness into system and operational performance.
Develop dashboards, tools, and automated reports at scale oriented to a) provide insight into performance and b) provide user-friendly access of the data and insights to non-expert audiences for analysis and manipulation.
Establish and maintain effective performance tracking; identify improvement opportunities, form hypotheses, and propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.

Decision Support:

Partner with functional teams to proactively analyze performance; use analytical techniques to assess data and provide recommendations to improve teams’ operational and strategic approach.
Analyze data to determine goals and performance thresholds to drive growth; create processes for automating performance insights via dashboard alerts, notifications, etc.
Provide analytical support for weekly, monthly, and quarterly business insight reviews.
Serve internal and external customers with diligence, persistence, and energy.
Initiate and drive special projects such as: critically evaluating user behavior to uncover what drives usage and adoption and help us uncover what our critical success factors should be along the way (e.g., Facebook’s “7 friends in 10 days”).



Who you are:

Driven, detail-oriented, and highly organized. You work well under pressure and are not afraid of doing hard things.
You are a strong individual contributor but can lead and communicate well with cross-functional teams.
You are an active problem solver and know how to find solutions.
You take extreme ownership in all aspects of your work and share credit when credit is due.
You can manage competing priorities and execute on agreed upon timelines.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and care deeply about the quality of excellence in our products, and for our clients, and will work hard to make sure they are taken care of.
You’re a proactive thinker that is always looking for ways to enhance the current processes.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can effectively communicate professionally and personally to other development teams and their Managers.
You want a tenured, meaningful career with Leads that lets you dig deep and plant roots.
You are energized by the fact that we are a fast-growing, mission-driven, innovative, and acquisitive team – looking for other bright minds to make us and themselves better along the way.



This might be you if you have SOME of the following:

4-5 years of Data Analytics experience; preferably working with big data and are able to make complex analytical concepts look and sound simple to others.
Have deep understanding of and the ability to execute statistical analysis techniques.
Proficiently using various analytical tools such as SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, Excel.
Have a Bachelor’s of Science/Bachelors of Arts, preferably in a field relevant to analytics (statistics, information systems, industrial engineering, finance, business, math, etc.).
Masters/Advanced degree in data/analytical field preferred.
Strong individual contributor that can work cross-functionally with various department stakeholders.



What you can expect from us:

We serve with energy, diligence, and persistence. We deeply believe the work we do makes a difference in the lives of our users, the communities they protect, and the victims they serve. We won’t stop pushing to make our products do more and to make each other better. You will have access to technical and soft skill training through sites like Pluralsight and RightNow Media to grow your skills. If we don’t have it and you think you should learn it, just ask. Further, we take our work seriously. Ourselves, not as much. You’ll have fun here.




Employer Paid Benefits

Medical insurance.
Vision insurance.
Dental insurance.
401(k) Safe Harbor match of 4% after 1 year of employment.
Paid maternity leave.
Paid paternity leave.
Disability insurance.
Flex schedule.
Robust PTO package.
$95,000 - $110,000 a year
Company-wide Bonus Target 10%

Senior Data Scientist

Position Description
CGI is seeking a Sr. Data Scientist to join our Emerging Technology Practice. Our cross-functional teams work closely with our clients to understand their business needs and implement cutting-edge solutions. We look for Data Scientists who are passionate about building and deploying machine learning models, have experience with the full stack end-to-end AI lifecycle, and are great communicators.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Engage in meetings with client stakeholders to drive out requirements
Analyze business problems and create impactful advanced analytic or machine learning solutions
Use data manipulation tools to source, transform, and blend data from multiple different data sources
Operationalize machine learning models for adoption across the enterprise
Write clear, concise, well-documented code and perform code review for peers
Translate business objectives into quantitative metrics to achieve business goals and drive KPIs
Ability to lead Jr. data scientists and analysts serving as a mentor
Prepare and present solutions to executive audiences

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Machine Learning

Ability to explain machine learning techniques and algorithms such as K-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
Use of statistical models including experience with regression, classification, clustering, NLP, and computer vision

Programming Abilities

Python, R, and SQL
Custom code to create, train, and deploy machine learning models or advanced analytics
Version/source control

Data Manipulation

Data warehouses and file stores such as Snowflake, RedShift, Teradata, BigQuery, Amazon S3, Amazon RDS, Azure Synapse, Databricks Lakehouse, etc.
Ability to ingest, blend, and transform data for modeling inputs including exposure to data storage, ETL, and manipulation tools
Unstructured data transformation, such as text documents or images
Utilization of embedding models and Vector DBs to transform and store natural language data

Communication and Interpersonal Skills

Ability to communicate about handling multiple priorities and deadlines
Data Narration and storytelling with demonstrated ability to present to executive audience
Participation in Go-To-Market initiatives to help CGI gain new clients and projects

BS or MS in Computer Science, Computational Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Data Science, Statistics or equivalent

Scaling production-facing applications in large enterprise environments
Exposure to creating MVP web application with Dash or Streamlit
Deep learning models - neural networks, auto-encoders, GPTs, etc.
Past experience in leading teams or mentoring junior resources
Previous consulting experience

Senior Data Analyst

At B&A, we foster and embrace a distinct set of values that we live by and instill in all aspects of our organization: dedication, commitment, partnership, trust, and recognition. We have incorporated these values into successful delivery for our customers since 1988. B&A believes in ensuring its employees feel deeply connected to B&A, recognizing successes and hard work, and providing continuous opportunities to learn and grow. Our people are entrepreneurial thinkers that combine mindset, vision, and experience to drive value – not only to us as an organization, but to the clients we support. We promote a collaborative culture with our clients, and with each other, as one team working towards a common vision. We’d love for you to join our team!

Job Summary
B&A is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join a contract with a federal government client in support of an important mission. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a great team while supporting the team.

Responsibilities

This role necessitates the employee to be based in the San Antonio area for on-site work at Fort Sam Houston.
Conduct highly complex data mining, statistical analysis, trend analysis, and causal analysis.
Act as a technical lead, responsible for monitoring and delivering monthly contract reports and deliverables.
Integrate multiple disciplines within an operations research team, translating methodologies into a language understandable by operational managers.
Review and ensure quality control of products.
Develop and update training materials to educate newly assigned personnel on key analytic tools, procedures, and methodologies.
Transform structured and unstructured data into cohesive analytical products for a contracting functional business area audience.
Utilize pattern analysis methods to formulate recommendations for operational managers by identifying patterns in past, current, and anticipated operational environments.

Education and Experience

A minimum of 8 years of experience in a technical field.
A Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, applied mathematics, statistics, or a related field is preferred.

Required Skills

Experience advising senior DoD decision makers on methodologies, results, and conclusions from applied operations research.
Proficiency in various research tools, including but not limited to Logistics Management Program, Vantage, Virtual Contracting Enterprise, General Fund Enterprise Business System (GFEBS), SAP Business Objects/Web Intelligence Reports, Microsoft SharePoint, Army-specific contract writing systems (Procurement Desktop Defense (PD2) and Procurement Automated Data and Document System (PADDS)), and various Government and Commercial business process automation systems.
Strong data manipulation and problem-solving skills.

Desired Skills

Proficiency in statistics, programming languages like R or Python, SQL (Structured Query Language), data visualization, and data cleaning and preparation.
Effective communication skills and strong problem-solving ability.

Security Clearance

Eligibility to obtain a federal Security Clearance.

KUNGFU.AI is a management consulting and engineering firm focused exclusively on artificial intelligence. We empower CEOs and senior executives to leverage the full potential of AI so they remain competitive in a rapidly evolving world.

Our expert team delivers AI strategy and bespoke production-grade solutions that allow clients to rapidly realize value. We stand apart because we implement our AI strategies into production quickly, safely, and responsibly.

Outside of our virtual walls we are painters, foodies, cocktail connoisseurs, musicians, crossword-doers, athletes, dungeon masters, non-profit board members, and more. We’d welcome the opportunity to meet you.

At KFAI, Strategy is about helping our clients to navigate the unique and unprecedented challenges associated with integrating AI/ML approaches into their organizations, and ultimately to identify and leverage AI/ML capabilities as a sustainable differentiator or competitive advantage.

As a Strategist at KFAI, you will be part of a uniquely business-value driven approach to helping our clients accelerate and de-risk their efforts to advance their AI capabilities and use cases. Your primary toolset will be creative quantitative and competitive analysis of clients’ AI imperative executed alongside direct observation, discovery and assessment of clients’ relevant organizational capabilities.
Here's what you'll deliver to our clients:
Tight articulation and quantifiable specification of the challenges and/or opportunities they hope to address through the application of AI/ML
Insider-level understanding of the nature of their business - from operational realities to legacy product roadmaps - acquired quickly and arrayed against a necessary grasp of the clients’ external strategic landscape
Fresh insights into the organizational, leadership, cultural, structural, and process realities that define the context in which our solutions must succeed
Evaluation of a client’s organizational assets - current and potential - based on a deep understanding of their full data assets and ecosystem (internal and external) as well as their core and differentiating core competencies
Tightly specified and actionable recommendations - implicating all of the above - that promise to advance their successful application of AI/ML, including assessments of feasibility and potential impact and options for roadmapping activities several years into the future
What we're looking for:
Someone who can independently conduct SME interviews across a wide diversity of backgrounds and functions, quickly isolating core stakeholder, organizational and engagement dynamics that could affect the validity and/or feasibility of our recommendations
Someone who can confidently and credibly hold a mirror up to a client, showing them things they are often not aware of and may be reluctant to admit
Someone who can apply a product management and/or design thinking mindset to organizing client recommendations and roadmaps
Someone who can collaborate seamlessly with some of the brightest engineers on the planet on engagements that require strategic alignment of engineering activities to ensure maximal client impact
A people person. Someone whose emotional intelligence and ability to communicate to a wide range of audiences (C-suite to IC, technical and non-technical) in a wide range of scenarios is a proven strength
Strong skills in business quantitative analysis including how business data is operationally originated and curated, used to generate financial reporting, capable of telling ‘stories’ about how organizations function, applied to compelling business cases supporting corporate valuation
An interest in working collaboratively with data scientists on the Strategy Team to conduct exploratory data analysis and formulate and test specific hypotheses
A basic fluency in data as it is applied in AI modeling. You have some understanding of different data types, what data governance is and why it’s important, what a machine learning model is and how it’s trained, etc. An interest in ethical AI is a must, but you don’t need to have experience in it
An appreciation of autonomy, research, people, and technology. This role is very interdisciplinary
Someone who probably has an advanced degree in a human-centric discipline (Business, Social Anthropology, Psychology, etc.), but it’s not a dealbreaker if you don’t
What's in it for you?

This is a full-time or contract-based position that is remote. For full-time team members, compensation includes competitive salary, company stock grant, top (‘gold’) level of health, dental and vision insurance (KUNGFU.AI covers 100% of your premiums and 50% for any dependents), health and dependent flexible spending accounts, short- and long-term disability insurance, unlimited vacation (that you're encouraged to take), paid parental leave, and more.



If this opportunity excites you, we can’t wait to meet you!
Please send your resume along with a cover letter explaining why you’re passionate about the idea of joining KUNGFU.AI and a great fit for this role.
Note: Due to ITAR compliance and regulations we are only able to hire US Citizens and Green Card Holders.

KUNGFU.AI Culture

We are committed to building an inclusive culture that’s professional and effective, while also fun, collaborative and open. We are proud to be the first company to take The Startup Diversity and Inclusion Pledge, which one of our co-founders started. We actively encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce fosters more creative ideas, conversations, and results.

We also believe in using AI for Good in both our client projects and our corporate philanthropy.

Our values are incredibly important to how we show up for each other, our clients, and for society at large. We expect all of our team members to be:

Inquisitive, in that they have an innate desire to learn and teach.
Inventive, in that nothing (ego, fear, etc.) gets in the way of innovation.
Open, in that they willingly share their learnings and experience with all.
Caring, in that they prioritize self-care, empathy, and an understanding of others.
Trustworthy, as that underpins all of the above.

Data Science Consultant




﻿Who You’ll Work With

As a modern technology consulting company, we thrive on tackling challenges; we are yet to meet a technical challenge we didn’t fall in love with. We empower our clients to harness insights from their data, create exceptional digital experiences, and fully leverage the potentials of new technologies. We blend design, engineering, and analytics expertise to build the future. We immerse our technologists in a stimulating environment filled with interesting challenges, innovative minds, and emerging technologies.


What You'll Do

Apply fundamental and advanced quantitative methods, including machine learning and statistical modeling, to solve complex business problems and enable data-driven decision making. For example, build statistical and machine learning models for trend analysis and forecasting to predict future business outcomes for a Fortune 50 company.
Work with a team of data professionals to integrate diverse data sources, establishing a comprehensive and unified view of the client's data landscape.
Efficiently synthesize large volumes of data, extracting meaningful insights in a structured and programmatic manner.
Create effective data visualizations to simplify and clarify complex data patterns and trends, and explain these complex concepts and business value to non-technical stakeholders.

What You’ll Bring

A passion for delivering transformative solutions by working closely with project teams and clients to design, build, deploy, learn, and optimize predictive models that drive business value for a wide variety of business applications and outcomes.
Experience with hypothesis generation and validation of modeling approaches by meticulously examining performance indicators.
Have utilized visualization techniques to profile and explore datasets, applied data quality remediation strategies, as well as effectively communicate results and modeling outputs.
Have actively participated in solutioning sessions, working hand-in-hand with business/client, translating business objectives into actionable machine learning/data science use case.
Have extensive experience programming using best practices with Python (including PySpark), R, and SQL, leveraging these tools to drive concrete business outcomes.

What You’ll Bring (Preferred)

Minimum of 3 years of industry hands-on experience in data science.
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field is a plus.
Experience with cloud and modern data science tools and platforms such as Databricks, AWS SageMaker, Kubeflow, and Azure ML.
Strong proficiency in statistical models (like ARIMA, Linear and Logistic Regression), machine learning algorithms (including Random Forests, LightGBM, and XGBoost), advanced techniques like Neural Networks and Deep Learning models (CNNs and RNNs), and familiarity with regularization techniques, optimization algorithms, and performance improvement techniques.
Proficiency in Python (including PySpark), R, SQL, and experience with libraries/frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn.
Experience with MLOps and DevOps, including best practices such as unit testing, source control (Git), and code review.
Experience building end-to-end data science solutions, including operationalizing models.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think critically about complex problems.
Previous experience in a data engineering role is a plus.
Prior experience in a leadership role, the ability to guide and manage a team effectively, will be highly advantageous.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including proficiency in selecting and creating effective data visualizations.

Job Summary

WFS is seeking a Data Scientist to join Project Management Office, North America. The ideal candidate will be responsible for integrating new data sources into our backend platform, creating custom data science models from scratch using the integrated data sources as well as maintaining existing data science tools. Additionally, the candidate should be comfortable building custom data science models based on large datasets as well as financial modeling based on structured data and hybrid models that consider both. The Data Scientist will also be expected to create new data processing pipelines and various data science processes including data preparation, training, classification, and deployment workflows.

As the Data Scientist, you should be able to provision your own environments in Azure ML or Amazon Sagemaker and use Pyspark, deep learning libraries, Pandas, and other relevant tools. The ideal candidate should not rely solely on off-the-shelf ML libraries and should be comfortable with creativity and customization of models. Your solutions should consider scalability, with optimized usage of distributed computing frameworks like Spark. This role will report directly to the Project Management Office, North America.

Responsibilities
Drive data analytics work focused on solutioning multiple and complex business problems, including generating hypotheses and delivering results.
Maintain ongoing forecasting efforts within WFS, including tuning and retraining of various models.
Provide WFS leadership with updates on ongoing data analytics initiatives in a layman-friendly, business-oriented manner.
Understand quality of data used in existing use cases, drive process improvements, and implement data quality routines.
Interact with WFS business on a regular basis for work prioritization and driving new use cases.
Provide operational support and maintenance of data science backend to enable various business reports.

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES
Collects, develops, analyzes and communicates institutional data and other information to constituents throughout the university. In collaboration with the VP, comply with all reporting obligations and support informed decision-making, problem solving, strategic planning, policy development, and institutional self-assessment. Maintain research standards consistent with What Works Clearinghouse principles for effectively assessing evidence-based research on campus. Performs applied research, and designs, executes, and evaluates analytical and statistical studies and/or institutional self-assessments. Designs and manages information systems and databases to support institutional assessment activities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Conducts and/or assists on a wide variety of research efforts for the department; participates in formulating research questions, developing data pipelines, designing research protocols and procedures, determining research outcomes and delivering research results.
Acquires, manipulates, develops, and maintains data sets and data collection infrastructure, verifying accuracy and consistency, consistent with the applicable standards.
Access and retrieve information from multiple databases including the university system of record and other contributing sources that are integral to the function of Institutional Research and Effectiveness (Jenzabar, Raiser’s Edge, PowerFAIDS, Canvas, JRM, etc.).
Prepares institutional assessment reports from an array of assessment tools (surveys, academic testing instruments, opinion polls, qualitative focus groups, etc.).
Assists faculty and staff with annual academic program and administrative assessment plans, meeting accreditation standards and university strategic planning measures.
Formulates and prepares institutional responses to external queries, and provides institution-wide support for obtaining assessment data and information and performing analyses in response to specific needs.
Designs, executes, analyzes, communicates, and consults on the results of custom research that provides insight on stakeholder perceptions and needs.
Coordinates with faculty and staff regarding the design and implementation of assessment activities, analysis and interpretation of data related to student learning outcomes, and the measures and tools used for assessment purposes.
Works with other executive institutional committees and staff to coordinate work and provide technical assistance, as assigned.
Understands the use of SQL, Python, R, Powershell/Bash, Advanced Microsoft Excel, SPSS, Power BI, Tableau and other data mining tools used for reporting and programming purposes.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED

Master’s degree in social science, computer science, information systems or related field, required.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community. Must be comfortable presenting and defending results to critical audiences.
Experience with multi-variate data analysis, such as linear and multiple regression, as well as parametric and non-parametric inferential statistical tests.
Ability to programmatically gather and analyze statistical data and generate reports from a wide variety of sources.
Understanding of organizational structure, workflow, and operating procedures.
Skill in designing, assessing, collecting, analyzing, verifying, and manipulating research data.
Ability to foster a cooperative work environment.
Willing to work in a fast-paced, high-demand work environment.
Outstanding interpersonal and community relations skills and the ability to communicate and work effectively within a diverse community.
Knowledge of database construction, management, and retrieval methods; familiarity with or the ability to learn campus information systems.

Job Description


The Data Analyst is a new role for blockit, joining a small but rapidly growing data team. This team has an ambitious remit to significantly impact the organization cross-functionally, ranging from client onboarding to schema normalization.

Data-driven transformation through the democratization and access of data via multiple platforms empowers our teams to make smarter decisions. Measuring the impact of those choices gives us the agility to adapt quickly when necessary. With the advent of these initiatives around data storage, centralization and automation, we anticipate massive gains in efficiency, growth in our core metrics, and a rising tide of excitement, morale and engagement.

You’ll be helping to build out a team of mathematicians, statisticians, analysts, and engineers and some of the most brilliant minds in healthcare technology. You will use your passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business, responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for blockit’s leadership team and internal stakeholders.

As we build and integrate cutting-edge technology in data infrastructure, cloud services, artificial intelligence, augmented/virtual reality, and machine learning, we’re excited to see blockit’s growth and success.

Primary Responsibilities:

Interpret data trends and patterns in the organization using existing datasets to identify opportunities for improvement and drive growth.
Build, own and manage initiatives to develop and automate tooling, dashboards & training to communicate relevant growth metrics to internal stakeholders, on a regular cadence and ad-hoc basis.
Responsible for generating all recurring and ad-hoc reporting for Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and multi-channel performance reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Deliver reporting and analytics to cross functional leadership teams, presenting insights and recommendations from analyses, utilizing data to influence behavioral change in company decision making.
Collaborate regularly with the engineering team to review data insights, drive performance automation and improvements with data infrastructure, pipelines and applications.
Collaborate with each department, driving projects in the organization to identify opportunities for improvement, aligning recommendations to the company strategy.

Excellent interpersonal skills with an emphasis on verbal/written communication, managing relationships, and professionalism
Highly collaborative, innovative and solution-oriented
Ability to work cross functionally with internal stakeholders in a fast paced environment
Entrepreneurial mindset with an ability to work independently, driving projects and company initiatives
Strong ability presenting abstract data concepts, storytelling and driving actionable results from analytical findings.

Education and Experience

A bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics or STEM based degree is preferred
1-3 years Analytics experience working with high volumes of data
Demonstrated experience in experimental design & interpretation, exploratory data analysis and prototyping required
Demonstrated technical experience in statistics, data models, database design development, data mining, normalization, cleaning, and segmentation techniques.
Demonstrated experience working with database experiences including proficiency in SQL, MySQL, python programming and API integration
Knowledge of BI Tools, Hive, No-SQL, Hadoop, Graph, Sigma or other data applications and related languages is a plus
Experience working in a SaaS, healthcare technology/IT, or healthcare B2B environment highly preferred
Experience working in a startup environment is desirable

Collaborative team players with strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Leadership presence with an ability to engage and influence key stakeholders across the organization and make an impact
Thought leaders that cultivate a culture of out-of-the-box thinking and innovation

Job Title: Principal Engineer II - Artificial Intelligence Applications
Job Description:
Overview

Who we are

Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.

This position is based in Plano, TX.

Toyota encourages all employees to live within a reasonable commuting distance of their assigned work location. Hybrid work from outside of the assigned work location may be permitted in a pre-approved list of states (AZ, CA, CO, GA, IL, IN, KY, MA, MI, MO, NJ, NY, OH, OR, TN, TX, VA, WV) with certain stipulations.

Speak with your recruiter and hiring manager to learn more about our hybrid work program.

To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position currently.

Who we’re looking for

Toyota’s Enterprise Artificial Intelligence Department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Artificial Intelligence Applications Principal Engineer.

The primary responsibility of this role is to work on cutting-edge research projects in generative AI.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, the person in this role will support the Enterprise Artificial Intelligence department's objective to make a real impact on the field of Artificial Intelligence.

What you’ll be doing

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a focus on generative AI techniques. In this role, the ideal candidate will develop generative machine learning models and systems to enable the automotive enterprise.

Research and implement generative models like GANs, VAEs, and diffusion models for automotive applications
Develop simulations leveraging generative models to synthesize sensor data, scenarios, and other driving environments
Engineer solutions using few-shot learning and prompt-based techniques to rapidly adapt models to new tasks
Optimize generative models for performance, scalability, and efficient deployment on embedded systems
Establish testing frameworks to validate model robustness, safety, and performance
Collaborate across teams to identify and assess use cases for generative AI in the enterprise.
Develop and deploy generative AI models for image generation, text generation, or music generation.
Develop new methods for training generative AI models on large datasets.
Develop new ways to deploy generative AI models in production.

What you bring

MS or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field
3+ years experience building and deploying AI systems
10 years of technology industry experience
Expertise in training and deploying large generative models like DALL-E, GPT-3, etc.
Proficiency with Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and related libraries
Strong software engineering skills and knowledge of model optimization techniques
Ability to solve complex problems through novel applications of generative AI
Passion for advancing safe autonomous vehicle technology

Added bonus if you have

The theoretical foundations of generative AI, including probability theory, statistics, and machine learning.
The practical skills necessary to develop and deploy generative AI models, including deep learning frameworks, large-scale data processing and analysis, and programming skills in Python or a similar language.
The ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.
The ability to work on cutting-edge research projects in generative AI, and to make a real impact on the field of artificial intelligence.

What we’ll bring

During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:

A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement
Vehicle purchase & lease programs
Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family
Flextime and virtual work options (if applicable)
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute
Paid holidays and paid time off
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more
Tax Advantaged Accounts (Health Savings Account, Health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA)

Belonging at Toyota

Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.


Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Are you a passionate and talented Data Scientist with a deep understanding of AI/ML and Advanced Analytics systems? Do you thrive on using data science algorithms to drive excellence and make impactful decisions? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you.

Job Responsibilities & Expectations:

As a Client Facing Data Scientist Consultant at Smartbridge, you will:

Identify problems, develop innovative ideas, and propose solutions for analytical, evaluative, or constructive thinking in various situations.
Translate complex business analytics problems into technical approaches that generate actionable recommendations across diverse functional domains.
Lead teams in analyzing and modeling structured or unstructured data, implementing advanced statistical and mathematical methods, and using machine learning and data mining techniques.
Ensure timely and on-budget project delivery, accomplishing client goals effectively.
Assist in planning and delivering multiple projects.
Demonstrate strong leadership skills, adaptability to challenges, and mentorship to team members.
Prepare and present ideas and recommendations to colleagues and upper management, providing guidance to less experienced team members.
Apply creative thinking to develop reporting solutions and alternatives.
Be the accountable person for statistical methods, machine learning model design, and defining the data science project lifecycle.
Travel to client locations as needed for projects.

Qualifications:

To be considered for this position, you should have the following qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field of study.
3-5 years of experience in consulting and technology services, with a focus on designing, deploying, and maintaining high-performance data and analytics solutions using agile methodology.
3-5 years of experience in one or more of the following sectors: Restaurants & Food Services, Energy / Oil & Gas, Construction, or Manufacturing.
3-5 years of full-stack data science experience with expertise in technologies such as Azure ML, R, Python, Streaming Analytics, Snowflake, Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Synapse, Power BI, and Tableau; certifications are preferred.
Working knowledge of machine learning, including time series forecasting models and deep learning approaches like RNN and LSTMs.
Proven experience in building and maintaining relationships with executives, senior leaders, and business decision-makers; existing relationships are a plus.
Strong background in traditional mathematics and statistics, including Bayesian Statistics, multi-variate analysis, hypothesis testing, Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE), Markov Chain Monte Carlo Simulation, Gaussian Processes, and Genetic Algorithms.
Active participation in conferences and seminars to promote and market services.
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, and a knack for delivering compelling presentations.
Please note that the compensation information that follows is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the Equal Pay Transparency Laws in numerous states we operate. It takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees.

Mach Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to create better defense systems for the US and its allies, fueled by hydrogen. With a vertically integrated energy chain, we offer capabilities impossible with conventional methods. Our innovative approach and commitment to advanced technology are transforming military capabilities.

Role Summary:

The AI Engineer will be instrumental in the research, development, and deployment of cutting-edge artificial intelligence algorithms to enhance the performance, safety, and reliability of our hydrogen-powered weapons systems, including drones, guns, and balloons. This role demands a profound understanding of AI and machine learning technologies, coupled with a deep interest in the defense sector, to propel our company into new frontiers of innovation.

Key Responsibilities:

AI Research and Development:
Conduct research to develop state-of-the-art AI and machine learning algorithms tailored for hydrogen-powered defense systems.

Model Training and Validation:
Build, train, and validate machine learning models to ensure they meet the specific requirements of our unique weapons systems.

Optimization and Scalability:
Work to optimize AI algorithms for real-time decision-making and scalability across diverse hardware platforms.

Security Compliance:
Ensure AI technologies are developed and deployed in accordance with military and industry-specific cybersecurity standards.

System Integration:
Collaborate with Hardware and Software Engineering teams to seamlessly integrate AI capabilities into existing and future products.

Data Management:
Develop robust data pipelines for training and evaluating machine learning models, including data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing.

Algorithm Auditing:
Conduct thorough audits of machine learning models to verify performance metrics, ethical considerations, and safety protocols.

Cross-Functional Communication:
Effectively communicate the impact and benefits of AI technologies to non-technical stakeholders within and outside the company.

Documentation and IP:
Maintain rigorous documentation for developed algorithms and contribute to the intellectual property portfolio of the company.

Quality Assurance:
Establish best practices for AI development to ensure high-quality, reliable, and safe deployment of algorithms.

Qualifications:

Minimum of 5 years experience in AI engineering, machine learning, or a closely related field.

Expertise in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.

Strong proficiency in machine learning libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.

Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, or similar.

Familiarity with military and industry-specific cybersecurity standards.

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.

Ideal Candidate:

An innovative thinker possessing both a deep technical expertise in AI and a passion for defense technology. The ideal candidate is highly collaborative and comfortable working in a fast-paced, Skunkworks-inspired environment, and has a track record of developing and deploying AI solutions that are both pioneering and practical.

Disclosures

Data Scientist

Full Time, 12-Month, Non-Exempt, Staff

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES
Collects, develops, analyzes and communicates institutional data and other information to constituents throughout the university. In collaboration with the VP, comply with all reporting obligations and support informed decision-making, problem solving, strategic planning, policy development, and institutional self-assessment. Maintain research standards consistent with What Works Clearinghouse principles for effectively assessing evidence-based research on campus. Performs applied research, and designs, executes, and evaluates analytical and statistical studies and/or institutional self-assessments. Designs and manages information systems and databases to support institutional assessment activities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Conducts and/or assists on a wide variety of research efforts for the department; participates in formulating research questions, developing data pipelines, designing research protocols and procedures, determining research outcomes and delivering research results.
Acquires, manipulates, develops, and maintains data sets and data collection infrastructure, verifying accuracy and consistency, consistent with the applicable standards.
Access and retrieve information from multiple databases including the university system of record and other contributing sources that are integral to the function of Institutional Research and Effectiveness (Jenzabar, Raiser’s Edge, PowerFAIDS, Canvas, JRM, etc.).
Prepares institutional assessment reports from an array of assessment tools (surveys, academic testing instruments, opinion polls, qualitative focus groups, etc.).

Works with other executive institutional committees and staff to coordinate work and provide technical assistance, as assigned.
Understands the use of SQL, Python, R, Powershell/Bash, Advanced Microsoft Excel, SPSS, Power BI, Tableau and other data mining tools used for reporting and programming purposes.

Willing to work in a fast-paced, high-demand work environment.
Outstanding interpersonal and community relations skills and the ability to communicate and work effectively within a diverse community.
Knowledge of database construction, management, and retrieval methods; familiarity with or the ability to learn campus information systems.

Job Summary

Travis County Auditor’s Office has an opening in its Risk Evaluation and Consulting (REC) Division for a data analyst/scientist. The REC Division supports the Auditor’s Office by bringing an independent systematic approach to ensure financial transparency and accountability by performing risk assessments, statutory, information system, contract compliance, and legislative analysis audits. We are looking for individuals who want to work in a progressive, challenging, and team-oriented work environment that accelerates employee growth and recognizes performance.

This is a grant funded position (funded until the end of calendar year 2026).

The position’s duties include applying statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various datasets, implementation of continuous monitoring processes, validating datasets, interview domain experts to gain an understanding of the business mechanics that generate various datasets, and working with staff internal auditors to provide data necessary to complete various audit objectives.

The County Auditor is the CFO of Travis County government, a $1 billion organization with approximately 6,000 employees. We offer a stable work environment, casual dress attire, quality computer equipment, professional development, 12 paid holidays, vacation accrual of up to 3 weeks per year, a flexible start of workday, excellent pension plan, and an extensive benefits package. We offer a flexible work schedule that is primarily remote, however, applicants must reside or be willing to relocate to Travis County or the surrounding area.



Duties and Responsibilities

Manage data extraction, storage, transformation, and processing through data analytics routines, and generate output for visualizations and audit testing for internal auditors.
Perform quality assurance and serve as a subject matter expert on data integrity, extraction, and compilation.
Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
Apply professional skepticism when assessing data sources and validating the completeness and accuracy of data received.
Identify, design, and develop data analytics extract routines to support audit activities performed by the staff internal auditors.
Interact and collaborate with the internal auditors in working towards departmental goals.
Execute on special projects and other assignments as requested by management.
Performs additional duties as needed within the department.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Accounting, or related field. Ideally, Master’s or PhD in related field and two years of relevant work experience, OR any combination of education and experience that has been achieved and is equivalent to the stated education and experience and required knowledge, skills, and abilities sufficient to successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this job.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Requirements:
Knowledge of:



Statistical concepts and methods and their application to process automation, advance data analytics, and machine learning.
Algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and anomaly detection.
Relational databases, including SQL, and large-scale distributed systems such as Hadoop and Spark.
Policies, practices, procedures, and terminology of assigned function.
Skills in:

Conducting qualitative and quantitative research and in using computers, software, and statistical tools and programs, including SPSS, SAS, Python, Visual Studio, Java, HTML, C#, VS Code etc.
Developing ETLs to analyze data using SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Python.
Verbal and written communication, including presentations and communicating technical issues in non-technical language.
Problem-solving and decision-making.
Ability to:

Develop measuring instruments to ensure relevance, reliability, and validity.
Extract meaningful business insights from data and identify the stories behind the patterns, using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Python.
Evaluate statistical data, by conducting qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Establish and maintain positive and effective working relationships with staff at all levels of the organization.



Work Environment & Other Information

A criminal, education, and employment background check is required. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. Sorry, no visa sponsorships.
Candidates who meet the above qualifications are encouraged to apply. Visit Travis County’s website to complete an application at: Travis County




Benefits
Employment at Travis County comes with a full array of benefits. We offer comprehensive health insurance, a no-cost, on-site Health and Wellness clinic, longevity pay, paid vacations, sick time and personal holidays, not to mention an industry competitive salary structure and a friendly, stable work environment.

FY2023 Travis County Benefit Guide

In this valuable Travis County Benefits Guide you will find benefit summaries, eligibility requirements, costs, contact numbers and addresses as well as other general information on the benefits available to Travis County Employees and Retirees.

Credit Union
Employees may join the Travis County Credit Union which offers low-interest loans, savings plans through payroll deduction, safe deposit boxes and other benefits.

Deferred Compensation
Employees may enroll in a tax- free sheltered investment plan through payroll deduction.

Direct Deposit
Employees may sign up for direct bank deposit.

Employee Assistance Program
Travis County provides a confidential counseling and referral service free of charge to county employees and their family.

Employee Organizations
Membership in the American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees Union is available through payroll deduction.

Employee Health & Wellness Clinic
Employees may access the clinic for a variety of wellness program and health care services with no co-pay, no deductible and no co-insurance costs.

Holidays
An average of eleven paid holidays are designated by the Travis County Commissioners Court at the beginning of each fiscal year.

Longevity
Longevity pay is paid for each year completed after three years of continuous service. Peace Officers in a law enforcement activity, whose job requires state peace officer certification, receive pay after one year of certification.

Parking
A limited number of assigned parking spaces are available to employees in the Courthouse Complex.

Personal Holidays
Regular, full-time employees are eligible for up to three paid personal holidays each calendar year. Part-time employees shall be granted personal holidays on a prorated basis. New employees earn personal holidays for the calendar year in which he/she begins employment, based on the month in which employment begins:

January – March
3 personal holidays
April - June
2 personal holidays

July - September
1 personal holiday

October - December
None

New employees are eligible to take personal holidays after 90 days of employment.

Retirement
Travis County is a member of the Texas County & District Retirement System with mandatory participation by certain classes of employees. Matching of two hundred twenty-five (225%) and a seven percent (7%) of the gross salary is deducted each pay period. An employee is fully vested after eight years of service. Benefits are prorated for part-time employees.

Sick Leave
Regular employees earn sick leave at a rate of eight hours per month with unlimited accrual during employment. Part-time employees earn sick leave on a pro-rated basis.

Parental Leave
Each Full-time Paid Parental Leave Eligible (PPL) Employee is entitled to a total of 320 hours of Paid Parental Leave in a 12 month period. Paid Parental Leave for Part-time PPL Eligible Employees is prorated based on the number of hours that they are regularly scheduled to work.

Tuition Refund
Certain classes of full-time employees may receive reimbursement for fees associated with pre-approved, job related course work completed satisfactorily.

Vacation
Based on years of county service, regular, full-time employees earn vacation time at the following rates:

0 to 5 years
4.0 hours per pay period
6 to 10 years
4.5 hours per pay period
11 to 15 years
5.0 hours per pay period
16 to 20 years
5.5 hours per pay period
21 plus years
6.0 hours per pay period

Part-time employees earn vacation leave on a pro-rated basis.

Workers' Compensation
The county provides all employees workers' compensation coverage with benefits in accordance with state statute, if the employee sustains an injury out of, or in the course of work.

Job Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer - Remote - USA
Job Description:
FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential.

We’re most proud of:
Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas.
Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world’s greatest companies.
Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users.
Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor.
Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average.
Job Summary:
FullStack is looking to hire several highly motivated Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Engineers to join our team. As an AI Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, testing, and implementing machine learning algorithms and models to solve complex problems and improve business outcomes. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams and executive leadership to design and deploy scalable and efficient AI models.
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and test machine learning algorithms and models.
Analyze and interpret large amounts of data to identify patterns and trends.
Implement and optimize models in production environments.
Develop and maintain documentation on machine learning models and processes.
Stay current with new developments in machine learning techniques and frameworks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into AI solutions.
Identify and address issues that may arise during development and deployment.
Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in designing and implementing machine learning algorithms.
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools such as Pandas, NumPy, or Matplotlib.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and inference techniques.
Benefits:
Competitive Salary.
Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays).
The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies.
Health, dental, vision insurance.
401(k) with 4% match.
Virtual company events each month.
Ample opportunity for career advancement.
Continuing education opportunities.
If you are a skilled AI Machine Learning Engineer looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we encourage you to apply!

FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process.

Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice.

Possible locations Spring TX, Corvallis OR, as well as remote work within the United States.

HP occasionally offers work authorization sponsorship for critical need roles. However, this opportunity does not offer work authorization sponsorship.

The Team

We are a growing centralized team helping HP take advantage of new AI/ML technology, especially around Generative AI and large language models. We engage with business units to advise and prototype solutions, and we also develop and run software applications.

The Role

We are looking for somebody who enjoys the dual work of UX design and UI development. Wearing your UX hat, you are passionate about creating simple and aesthetically pleasing user interfaces. You stay up to date with the UX of new AI-powered consumer and business products (e.g. ChatGPT). Wearing your UI engineering hat you take your design to a product working closely with the rest of the software team. AI will fundamentally change how users interacts with business applications and you will play a role in bringing this change to HP’s internal applications.


Skills and Profile

Ability and desire to work both with UX and UI software development.
Solid experience working as software UI developer in a development team
Experience defining UX for web applications, considering both usability and aesthetics.
A plus for any of the following: chatbots, analytical applications, search engine UX, A/B testing in consumer apps.
We currently use React for web UI although this is not set in stone. Other technologies the team is using include Azure, python, langchain, micro services, docker, CI/CD, Elastic Search, SQL and NoSQL.
The recent AI progress is disruptive, and our team is in the midst of it! As a consequence, day-to-day priorities, tasks, and team structure may change rapidly. We are looking for somebody who thrives in such an environment. The role is not a fit if you value "business as usual".
Experience working in a distributed team containing a variety of cultural backgrounds. Ability to engage in discussions in a respectful manner.
Mastery in English is required.

Education and Length of Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar, or demonstrated competence, plus a minimum of 4-6 years of relevant experience.


About HP


You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.
So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.


HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.


Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.
From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

We are seeking an Excel expert with additional general technology knowledge and expertise to run our suite of proprietary Excel-based software. Candidates can have any education background but a degree in computer science, data science, and/or finance is a plus. Extreme location and hours flexibility, and commission component of compensation plan can result in extremely lucrative position for high achievers. Excellent performers will have extreme growth and management opportunities as well.

Job Title: ML Framework Software Development Engineer - Generative AI
Job Description:
Overview:
WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING
We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. AMD together we advance_
Responsibilities:

We are looking for an AI Software development engineer who is passionate about building and optimizing deep learning applications and machine learning frameworks.

THE PERSON:
The ideal candidate has strong technical and analytical skills in high performance C++. Able to communicate effectively and work optimally with different teams across AMD. Experience in tensor libraries or machine learning execution engines is a plus.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Optimize key deep learning models on AMD GPUs
Develop and finetune inference and serving engines for large language models
Collaborate with AMD’s architecture specialists to improve future products
Collaborate with operator libraries team to analyze and optimize training and inference for deep learning

Participate in new ASIC and hardware bring ups
Apply your knowledge of software engineering best practices

PyTorch or TensorFlow
Familiarity with ML Graph Compilers (Glow, FX, XLA) is a plus
Knowledge of the lower levels of typical ML workflows from MLIR to LLVM all the way down to assembly language(s) is a plus

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fields

The worldwide data management software market is massive (IDC forecasts it to be $136 billion by 2027!). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading developer data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

The Senior Data Analyst, Personalization will play a meaningful role in further developing our rapidly growing Data Analytics function focusing on personalization. Partnering with stakeholders within the analytics team, the marketing and marketing operations teams, as well as production management and with other teams around the business, this role will surface key insights to drive business decision making. This role requires someone with strong analytical and technical skills, and who is comfortable working across multiple functional areas in a fast-paced, challenging environment.

This role can be based remotely in the North America region.

Responsibilities
Surface insights to drive executive decision making across the business
Partner with Marketing teams and product to support design, execution and analysis of experiments across a variety of channels (paid ads, email and website) to optimize content to users and improve their experience in product
Leverage deep understanding of statistics to conduct analyses that help partner teams make quicker, more informed decisions to help the business be more agile
Write and maintain complex queries to conduct deep-dive analyses on the impact marketing initiatives have on acquisition, product activation and user retention
Work closely with Data Architecture and Data Engineering teams to help create and optimize custom views and tables to enable reporting for marketing and growth teams
Make the team more efficient: Research and implement new tooling/processes; seek out and automate existing costly manual processes
Serve as an analytical and technical thought partner to stakeholders across the analytics, developer relations and broader marketing teams
Skills & Attributes
3+ years of hands-on analytics experience with for marketing and / or growth teams, ideally at a software company
Advanced SQL skills and proficiency with either Python or R
Deep understanding of applied statistics and demonstrated success of partnering with marketing teams to conduct a wide range of experiments
Experience with customer segmentation, customer journey analysis, clustering analysis and UX research
Exposure to predictive analytics and machine learning based recommendations is a bonus
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and set priorities with a variety of key stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Effective at communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Committed to contributing to a collaborative, enjoyable, and psychologically safe work environment

We provide credit and financing, treasury and payment services, international banking and real estate services to clients including corporations, municipalities, institutions, real estate investors and owners, and nonprofit organizations.

Position Objective & Summary:
As a Data Scientist specializing in operations excellence analysis at Cenergistic, with a focus on AI and machine learning, you will play a pivotal role in evaluating operational data to uncover innovative approaches for measuring and enhancing our performance. This role combines data analytics, statistical modeling, and advanced AI/ML techniques to make data-driven decisions that drive operational efficiency and excellence. This role will report to the SVP, Product Innovation & Analytics.
Essential Responsibilities:
Data Analysis and Visualization: Collect, clean, and analyze operational data from various sources to gain insights into our processes and performance. Utilize AI and ML algorithms to extract patterns and trends. Create informative visualizations to communicate findings effectively.
AI and ML Modeling: Develop and implement AI and machine learning models to predict operational outcomes, identify anomalies, and suggest improvements. Leverage natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision where relevant to extract insights from unstructured data.
Performance Assessment: Continuously monitor and evaluate our operational performance using AI/ML-based predictive and prescriptive analytics. Benchmark our operations against industry standards and historical data to identify areas for improvement.
Innovative Approaches: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify new and innovative ways to measure and enhance operational excellence using AI and ML technologies. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and ML to drive improvements.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with departments across the organization, including Operations, Finance, and Sales, to align operational strategies with overall business objectives.
Reporting and Presentations: Prepare and deliver reports and presentations to senior management and stakeholders, conveying AI/ML-driven insights and recommendations clearly and concisely.
Data Governance: Ensure data quality, security, and compliance with relevant regulations and standards, with a focus on AI and ML data ethics and transparency.
Continuous Learning: Stay updated with AI and ML industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in operations management and data analytics to continuously improve our operational strategy.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in data analysis and modeling, with a strong focus on AI and machine learning.
Proficiency in AI/ML libraries and tools, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Proficiency in data manipulation tools and languages like Python, R, or SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or matplotlib.
Strong statistical analysis and machine learning skills.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex AI/ML findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of operational management systems and best practices is a plus.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


Benefits
Competitive base salary plus bonuses based on both company and individual performance. Comprehensive benefits package includes 401k, medical insurance, HSA, FSA, dental and vision insurance, long-term disability insurance (LTD is at no cost to employee), flexible time schedule, company holidays and paid time off (PTO) days.
About Cenergistic®
Cenergistic, The Sustainability Company, is a technology-powered, data-informed, and people- first energy conservation company. We help our clients sustain the comfort of their customers, lower the cost of energy consumption, and advance a culture of conservation. Cenergistic has an ambitious goal to double, within 5 years, the $5 billion we have saved our clients. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Title: Assistant Data Scientist - Lee Lab (RNA seq)
Job Description:
SUMMARY

Genetic alterations are known cancer drivers, but not all patients harbor sufficient driver mutations to elicit the onset and progression of the disease. There also exist cancers such as pediatric tumors and several liquid cancers that carry very few genetic alterations, highlighting the contribution of non-genetic alterations to tumor formation. The Lee Laboratory seeks to elucidate how RNA aberrations impact the development and progression of cancer. We employ cutting-edge sequencing to uncover errors hiding in RNA and use multidisciplinary approaches including cell biology, biochemistry, molecular biology and protein biology to determine the pathogenic role of altered RNAs in malignant transformation. We hope to provide novel strategies for cancer diagnosis, prognosis, and therapeutic intervention.

The primary purpose of the Assistant Data Scientist is to provide bioinformatic support to ongoing research efforts and develop pipelines and novel methods for analysis of data from next generation sequencing.

Ideal candidate will have experience analyzing bulk or single cell RNA-seq data.

KEY FUNCTIONS

Performs bioinformatics analysis of bulk and single cell RNA-seq datasets
Maintains and develops pipelines to analyze 3'-seq data
Develops methods to provide bioinformatic and statistical support for research projects
Organizes, maintains and documents data, algorithms and software
Willing to learn and establish new methods that are required for lab research

Other Skills

Expertise in scripting and programming languages such as Python, PERL, Unix or R
Knowledge of bioinformatics tools used in gene expression analysis
Knowledge of biology, gene expression
Excellent communication skills and team-working attitude

Other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION

Required: Bachelor's degree in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Computational Biology, or related field.

EXPERIENCE

Required: None.

Preferred: working experience analyzing bulk or single cell RNA-seq data.

Job Title: Full Stack Software Engineer - SaaS (AI Solutions)
Job Description:
Full Stack Software Engineer - SaaS (AI Solutions)


This role has been designated as ‘Remote/Teleworker’, which means you will primarily work from home.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


About this role

As a full stack software engineer on the SaaS team, you will be responsible for providing a best-in-class experience for software-as-a-service users of our cutting-edge deep learning platform. Your work will enable research teams to get access to the latest in deep learning techniques and scale their training across tens or hundreds of GPUs at the click of a button. Your work will save research teams time and effort in operationalizing their deep learning training, enabling them to focus on training models instead of infrastructure and setup.

You will have the opportunity to define major aspects of our product: you’ll be expected to take on difficult problems without clear solutions, and to design, build, and iterate until we’ve reached elegant solutions that delight our customers. Along the way, you’ll work in a supportive and collaborative environment, with the opportunity to contribute across the stack based on your interests and experience.

Requirements

As a baseline, we would expect you to bring:

Strong problem solving and the ability to reason through unfamiliar challenges.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to collaborate with individuals with a broad range of skillsets and experience levels, across engineering, product, and design.

An exceptional track record of designing, implementing, testing, and debugging scalable, reliable production-quality software.

Experience developing well-tested client-side web applications and reusable UI components.

Familiarity with API patterns and back-end frameworks and languages.

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience

NOTE: Knowledge of machine learning or statistics is not required.

Preferred

One or more of these would make you a stronger fit for the team:

Experience with React, TypeScript, and Go

In-depth knowledge of building and deploying software on AWS, GCP, or Azure

Experience being on-call for production systems

Interest or experience in machine learning

#aisolutions

Additional Skills:

Cloud Architectures, Cross Domain Knowledge, Design Thinking, Development Fundamentals, DevOps, Distributed Computing, Microservices Fluency, Full Stack Development, Security-First Mindset, Solutions Design, Testing & Automation, User Experience (UX)

Health & Wellbeing

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

Personal & Professional Development

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
